messages.subject: Re: Pic of my girls
messages.msgSnippet: ... write I ve ... it. ... teach my son ... letters look ... Tamzin uses almost all capital letters when she writes. She says it looks better . I think she
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@y..., "Marietta Shirk" <mariettashirk@h...>
wrote:
> Thanks for explaining, I was like "what the heck??!!" LOL
> You don't want to see my handwriting, it's horrible. When I
write I've
> reverted to using all capitals. It's the only way anyone can read
it.
> Speaking of this, I'm wondering if this is a legitimate way to
teach my son
> all his handwriting....all caps. He knows what all the other
letters look
> like obviously since they're it books that way.
>
> Marietta
> Matthew 4 1/2
> Alexander 1


Tamzin uses almost all capital letters when she writes. She
says 'it looks better'. I think she finds it easier to form capitals
(doesn't require so many even little circles <g>).
Let your son 'teach' himself. He'll choose which way works best
for him, Tamzin did. All learning is legitimate (even if the 'experts'
say otherwise).

Meghan

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Pic of my girls
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for explaining, I was like what the heck??!! LOL You don t want to see my handwriting, it s horrible.  When I write I ve reverted to using all
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for explaining, I was like "what the heck??!!" LOL
You don't want to see my handwriting, it's horrible. When I write I've
reverted to using all capitals. It's the only way anyone can read it.
Speaking of this, I'm wondering if this is a legitimate way to teach my son
all his handwriting....all caps. He knows what all the other letters look
like obviously since they're it books that way.

Marietta
Matthew 4 1/2
Alexander 1

>

what

> suggestion to use a John Holt quote or something else good for
unschoolers,
> and there are only two so far! Others are welcome to put writing up
> too--encouraged!
>
>

> Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Pic of my girls
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/17/02 1:50:03 PM, mariettashirk@hotmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/17/02 1:50:03 PM, mariettashirk@... writes:

<< Sandra, what's with the handwriting stuff there in the photos? >>

We were talking about what's missing in e-mail, and one thing is seeing what
people's handwriting looks like. So there was a call for samples, with a
suggestion to use a John Holt quote or something else good for unschoolers,
and there are only two so far! Others are welcome to put writing up
too--encouraged!



Sandra

messages.messageBody:
Love all the photos! We had a family photo taken this year (gasp!) and I'll
get to scanning it eventually :)

Sandra, what's with the handwriting stuff there in the photos?

Marietta
Matthew 4 1/2
Alexander 1
